abstract: After rebuffing an unsolicited $10 billion offer by Amgen that it deemed too low, the maker of cancer drugs hired an investment bank to seek new suitors.
snippet: After rebuffing an unsolicited $10 billion offer by Amgen that it deemed too low, the maker of cancer drugs hired an investment bank to seek new suitors.

headline.main: Onyx Rejects Amgen’s Takeover Bid, Then Places Itself on the Market
headline.print_headline: Maker of Cancer Drugs Rejects Takeover Bid, Then Places Itself on the Market

byline.original: By Michael J. de la Merced and Andrew Pollack
